Name: Diaspora Skirmish: Basic Rules
Description:
Diaspora is a miniatures skirmish game, where two to four players can compete in narrative scenarios between the stars of the Second Middle Ages. Recruit your team from one of the exotic factions of the great Diaspora, and accomplish goals on the table by combining strategy and boldness.

The rules of the game are available for free, and with each faction comes its 3D printable figures.

Simple and quick to learn, Diaspora is a fluid system that is sure to make you rack your brains during tactical and colorful actions.

The basic rules contain everything you need to play your first games. 
Both novices and experienced wargames will find a fluid system and 4 scenarios. 
Along with these free rules also come two unit profiles from two different factions. 
The other profiles will be available in the Faction Compendiums. 
These rules may be updated in the future.

—description (translated) from the publisher

Name: Endangered World
Description:
Endangered World is strategic, family-friendly board game designed for 2-4 people ages 8+.

Players take turns drawing number cards, which denote spaces on the 10x10 grid on the gameboard. On the board are 15 adorable animal figures of different sizes, as well as 20 "Twists & Turns" cards that can really throw the game for a loop.

On each turn, the player decides how to use their resources. How much do they want to invest in a certain animal? Do they want to play a Defender token to protect their surrounding resources? Or maybe a Bomb token to destroy their opponent's resources? The person with the most resources on an animal saves it, and the person who saves the most animals in the end is the winner!

Name: Viscera
Description:
Viscera is a fast paced tabletop game made by Chris Robert and Cole Basaraba where two to six people buy items, roll dice, and hunt monsters of varying mythologies to become the land's greatest hero.

Player can acquire cards and gems to prepare for a monster hunt. Players will roll and reroll dice as they try to inflict enough damage to defeat the monsters. The monsters are kept as trophies for Victory points.

The player with the most victory points at the end of the game wins!

-description from designer

Name: Nowhere to Run
Description:
A solo dice game about getting back home.

Inspired on the cult film The Warriors.


Postcard released in the August 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


SETUP
A postcard game where your gang is represented by the Hearts suit (Ace to Jack), and then you will deal 6 cards to form the leaders of the other gangs, and add some more cards according to the suit.

HOW TO PLAY
Roll both dice and lock a die, if possible, on one of 3 actions: Fight, Weapon, and Take Trains. Then roll the other die to get a number equal or higher to take that action, or get one of your gang cards wounded.

You will be advancing in a track, having to defeat all gang members at a location before moving, or taking a train to advance anyway.

You will also be able to build weapons to heal your gang or clear other enemy gang.

If you make it HOME before discarding your whole gang, you win!

Name: Beat the Parents: Disney
Description:
It’s Kids vs. Adults in a head-to-head challenge on everything Disney! Relive your favorite Disney moments and create some new ones as Kids and Parents compete in a game of Disney questions and challenges. Take on multiple question categories such as “Name The Character”, “Disney Detective”, “Wild Card” and more. The first team to get both mover pieces across the board wins the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Curmudgeon: Promo Card Pack
Description:
These 30 cards are yours to customize your Curmudgeon experience. The pack includes: 
1 new Curmudgeon Card
8 Blank Insult Cards (write your own cards: four 1-point and four 2-point)
4 new Insult Cards 
5 new Life Cards
12 Blank Life Cards (write your own cards: three each of 1, 2, 4, & 4-points)

—description from the publisher

Name: Aroma
Description:
Description by the Publisher:

The Aroma™ board game by Organic Aromas is a one-of-a-kind journey into the heart of the world of essential oils. With 4 incredible ways to play, the goal is to test your knowledge and your nose! The game comes complete with 20 different all-natural essential oils for you to challenge your sense of smell. Divided into four different categories, the essential oils are steam extracted from plants, trees, flowers, and fruits. Locate and bring your oils home in “Collect” or use your olfactory prowess to strategically eliminate your opponents in “Survive”. You’ll need to use quick wits, a bluff or even trickery as it will take more than just a keen sense of smell to win at this game.

Name: Dogs' Day
Description:
Cats now rule the city and led the dogs to marginality. In this scenario, dog mafias organize themselves for a big heist to the Bank of Meow City. You lead one of these mafias seeking to score high.

Dogs' Day is a filler that uses hand management, a little bit of social deduction, heavy bluffing, and backstabbing.

It was created by Sergio Halaban, known for Sheriff of Nottingham, Quartz, and Matryoshka. It is a fast-paced variable turn order game, with some similarities to other games like Libertalia and Citadels, but keeping its originality by twisting and turn the resolution order of rounds.

Dogs rob the Bank of Meow City and then, as there's no honor among thieves, they steal each other, trying to score higher amounts of money than their foes.

Name: The Red Cathedral: Promo 1 – The Thieves' Guild
Description:
Thieves and swindlers were also present during the construction of St. Basil’s Cathedral. Instead of placing a Clergy card, place a random card from the Thieves’ Guild.

—description from the rules sheet

This promo consists of three Thieves' Guild influence cards.

Name: Pentaquark: Colliders (BGotMC edition)
Description:
This is the first post-campaign content for Pentaquark and we have a few more colliders, which generally will help you along the way, but not always (MoEDAL is a neat exception). MoEDAL, CMS and TOTEM join ALICE, ATLAS and LHCb in our collection of player aids.

—description from the publisher


Colliders is a 3-card micro-expansion for Pentaquark that brings a new level of complexity to the game. One of three condition cards are drawn the beginning of the game to aid you in your efforts.


This entry is for the Board Game of the Month Club edition from June 2017 package, which contains CMS, MoEDAL and TOTEM Colliders.

Name: Potions & Profits
Description: In Potions and Profits, you are a Wizard representing one of many pharmaceutical corporations looking for new Potions to invest in. Competing Wizards will try to outbid you for Potions as you balance both your Stock Value and your Public Relations. The most profitable Potions tend to be the least ethical but that doesn’t matter so long as your investors are happy and not too many protesters are kicking down your door. Become the most profitable corporation you can by either monopolizing one type of Potion or by simply having the best pharmaceutical line around. It’s just business, magical or otherwise.

Name: Necromunda: House of Iron
Description:
This book expansion includes new rules and ideas for House Orlock.

In just a few short millennia, House Orlock has risen from a loose alliance of Clan Families and waste prospectors to become the largest mining operation on the planet. The image that the House of Iron present to outsiders is one of veteran rebels, outland ash-riders, and bare-knuckled hardmen. This is entirely intentional, and the heads of the Orlock mining families have worked long and hard to cultivate a soldier class within the clan to fight for its interests and keep the drudging classes in line.

Get the ultimate guide to House Orlock. This 128-page book features the definitive history of the House and rules for fielding the six different types of fighters available to House Orlock – Road Captains, Road Sergeants, Arms Masters, Wreckers, Gunners, and Greenhorns. It's ideal for fans of House Orlock or anyone who wants to delve deeper into the dark side of the underhive.

Inside this book you'll find:

• House Orlock History and Background

• House Orlock Gang List

• Hangers-On and Brutes

• Hired Guns: Includes rules for using Bounty Hunters, House Agents, and Hive Scum

• Strong Alliances: Includes rules for using and forming alliances with three other organisations on Necromunda connected to House Orlock, such as the Guild of Coin, Outlawed Fallen Houses, and House Ran Lo - the Noble House that backs the House of Iron

• Additional Rules: New and additional rules usable by House Orlock gangs in games of Necromunda, providing Orlock players a variety of new options, including Skills, Abilities, Orlock terrain rules, and more

• Weapon Reference Chart: Contains a comprehensive weapons reference chart for all weapons and wargear available to House Orlock and their allies

• House Orlock Gang Tactics: Contains a D66 table of 18 new Orlock Gang Tactics for use in scenarios

• Dramatis Personae: Includes rules for hiring and using three brand-new Dramatis Personae characters in your games of Necromunda

This expansion is compatible with Necromunda: Underhive, Necromunda: Dark Uprising, and the Necromunda 2018 rulebook.

Name: Invasion of the Brood
Description:
In the year 2025, the telepathic monster Broodmaster Magnalux has established a base on Earth’s moon. As the human player, you must alert humanity to the threat, and rally armies, navies, and air forces against the alien menace. As the Broodmaster player, you must subvert the Earth, using your mind control to gradually take control of Earth’s most vital defenses.
 Invasion of the Brood is a two-player strategy game, in which the two sides have greatly different strategies, abilities, and even turn structures. Will humanity pull together to stop this alien invasion, or will the sinister Broodmaster take over the world? You decide!

Name: Carcassonne: The Peasant Revolts
Description:
With this mini expansion you have to weigh up whether you want to protect yourself against insurgent farmers or if you let the riots come your way unprepared.

Game components: 12 new land tiles, 1 rule (DE/EN)

—description from the publisher

https://cundco.de/media/pdf/79/65/49/Bauernaufstaende-final-_Regel_D_E_11.pdf

https://wikicarpedia.com/index.php/The_Peasant_Revolts

Carcassonne - Die Bauernaufstande

In this mini-expansion you have to decide, whether you want to protect yourself against insurgent peasants (and hence direct their anger against your fellow players) or rather take things as they come.

This expansion has cities with clipped buildings.

This expansion has been developed for the Carcassonne basic game. All the basic game rules still apply in addition to the expansion rules below. You can combine it with other expansions - but at your own risk – that is, there will be no official rules for these combinations.

Contents
12 new land tiles for peasant revolts with symbols for the respective features.

Peasant Revolts tile

5x cities

4x roads

3x monasteries
Rules
Preparation
Shuffle the 12 land tiles of this mini-expansion. Put 3 of them back into the box (without looking at them). Those tiles will not be used in this game. Shuffle the remaining 9 tiles and the other land tiles together.

Gameplay
1. Placing a tile
The peasants revolt

As soon as you draw a peasant revolt tile, a revolt takes place. Place the tile in front of you. [1] Now check, if one or more of your meeples are standing on features shown on the diamond-shaped symbol of the tile (city, road or monastery), and if those meeples are "unprotected" or "protected".

All of your unprotected meeples on the respective features, must be returned into your supply immediately.

Every protected meeple on the respective features scores 2 points. Protected meeples remain protected after the revolt.
     
(How you can protect your meeples, will be explained in 2. Placing a meeple.)

Note: If you had to return at least one meeple, the revolt is over and you continue with your normal turn.

Example 1: You draw a land tile with the peasant revolt symbol for roads (symbol enlarged in this example).
Your unprotected meeple is standing on a road on the left. Put the meeple back into your supply. Your protected meeple on the right stays on the tile and scores 2 points.
The revolt is over. The blue meeple has not been affected. Now, place the land tile according to the usual rules and continue your turn.
The peasant revolt moves on to the next player

If you do not have to return a meeple to your supply, because none of your meeples are standing on affected features or because all of your meeples, on affected features, are protected, the peasant revolt moves on and hits the player to your left. They also check, in the same way as described before, whether or not the revolt affects them and if they score points for protected meeples. If they, also are not affected by the peasant revolt, it moves on to the next player.

This continues until a player has to return at least 1 meeple to their supply, or none of the players have been affected. Now, place the land tile according to the usual rules and continue your turn.

Note! Only players, who have to check their meeples during the peasant revolt, score points for their protected meeples. Players who are not hit by the peasant revolt cannot score any points for protected meeples.

Example 2: You draw a land tile with the peasant revolt symbol for cities (symbol enlarged in this example). All of your meeples in cities are protected and you score 4 points.
The peasant revolt moves on to Blue. Blue is sitting to your left, and continues to check, if and how the peasant revolt affects them. Blue has 1 protected meeple in the city on the left, which scores 2 points. The unprotected meeples have to be returned into Blue’s supply. That is how the revolt ends and you place the land tile according to the usual rules and continue your turn.
2. Placing a meeple
Protecting a meeple from a peasant revolt

If you place a meeple on the tile just placed, you may also protect this very meeple, for the cost of 4 points. To do so, move your meeple on the score board back by 4 spaces. It is possible to score negative points. Next, “lay down” this meeple. This meeple has now joined the farmers. [2]

Example: Protecting a meeple
Each time you do not place a meeple on the tile you just have placed, [3] you may protect one of your meeples standing on tiles for the cost of 2 points.

Farmers cannot be protected. They are never affected by peasant revolts.

A meeple “lying down” is protected from a peasant revolt. In case the revolt affects you, you score 2 points for each protected meeple in an affected feature (see 1. Placing a tile).

3. Scoring a feature
When scoring a feature, a protected meeple is treated like a normal meeple. It is returned into your supply after the feature has been scored. After that, it loses its protection from peasant revolts. This means, that if you place that meeple again, it is unprotected once again.

Example: The city has been completed. You have the majority of meeples (2 in this case) and score 10 points.
Blue does not score any points. Return all meeples from the city back into your supplies and place them upright. They are now unprotected once more.
Final scoring
Final scoring is performed according to use usual rules. When scoring a feature, a protected meeple is treated like a normal meeple.

Name: Happy Little Dinosaurs: Exclusive Edition
Description: This exclusive edition of Happy Little Dinosaurs contains the core game, the 5-6 player expansion pack and five exclusive cards.

Name: Roberto Chiavini's Horse Racing
Description:
Roberto's take on the Sport of Kings - Horse Racing - is a simple, statistically based sports simulation allowing gamers to replay historical Flat, Jump, Steeplechase, and Harness races from 1900 into the 21st century.

Horses are classes A through H and may also have a set of asterisks indicating their chances of winning close races.

The races are run over a number of steps (usually 6 or 10), and each step consists of a dice roll cross referenced to a set of charts which indicate how each horse fares against the pack.  Additional rolls are required to determine accidents, and close races lead to an additional "photo finish" step.

Name: Pale Blue Dot
Description:
Discover your Origin - Create your Destiny, in this game of planetary balance by Arch & Gravity, blending coop and vs play with real science and fun sci-fi. Erupt as a Volcano, destroy with a Meteor, or travel the world as a Super Typhoon, using the innovative E3 gameplay system - Energy, Entropy & Evolution. Make tactical decisions as you build your area of control on the 3D, stackable board, Evolve as you customize your deck, and influence the Atmosphere to encourage the growth of Life - or to keep it's exponential dangers in check.  In Pale Blue Dot, the fate of this fragile world is in your hands, and winning is not just about dominance, because the odds of surviving as a habitable world are simply, powerfully against you every time. So while there can be just one winner in the end, even surviving will take everyone working together in balance.

—description from the publisher

Name: Can You Survive 2020?
Description:
"Can You Survive 2020?" is a silly game for serious gamers. There is some strategy involved, and also a ton of chaos. Written by Gen Z parents living the COVID life 24/7 with Gen Z kids, the game exudes its own version of twisted humor.

Players initially race around the board, buying up stock before the value collapses. While doing that, you are spreading a virus wherever you go, drawing notification cards (made from the insane things that have happened in 2020), and collecting toilet paper and homeopathy pills. Eventually, as spaces get quarantined, players are forced into the Bunker for the Lockdown Round.

At any point in the game if any one player dies from too much virus the game ends. You have to work together to stay alive, while also trying to get the most resources. Once the game ends players count their resources to win "Trophies." Trophies can be won for things like holding the most stock, the most toilet paper, AND (of course) a "Participation Trophy" for the individual who loses so - trophies for everyone!

The player with the most trophies wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Beets Bombs and the Blüffs
Description:
The life of a Blüff is simply really...

Plant beets, plant bombs to protect those beets, and try not to explode!

Blüffs take turns by strategically planting beets and bombs, and bragging or bluffing about how many beets they think they can find without blowing themselves up.

But be careful...there are all sorts of exciting action cards to keep Braggy Blüffs on their toes as they brag, plant, and bluff their way to a belly full of tasty beets.

—description from the publisher

Name: Beets Bombs and the Blüffs: The Super Action Packed Expansion Pack
Description:
Combine this expansion pack with the Beets Bombs and the Blüffs base game to play with up to 8 players! Adds an additional 42 card deck to the existing game! Including 13 new unique and exciting action cards!

—description from the publisher

Name: Marry the Monster
Description:
You are a duke trying to build up your lands where the monstrous fachan is rampaging. But he is just lonely. Your cunning plan is to make a false bride for him just behind your rivals’ buildings. The love-struck monster will crash through the other dukes’ lands, destroying them, while you continue to build up yours!
 Marry the Monster is a game for 3 to 5 players in which each player scores points by building structures and having them remain until your next turn without being destroyed by the monster. Turns are taken by playing cards, and there is no upkeep phase – play simply continues until there is a winner.'

Name: Boxing the Noble Art
Description:
A semi-statistical replay game allowing gamers to replay entire tournaments or individual bouts.

Historical fighters are rated for Boxing Quality, Knock Outs For and Knock Outs Against, and Fight Quality.

With just a couple of dice rolls players can determine a KO or points victory with the Basic Game.  Or they can go round by round, blow by blow, the dice and charts telling a compelling story of control, ascendancy and power.

Name: The Grand Magus of Ibaur
Description:
The legion is coming upon the Land of Ibaur. You - The Grand Magus - are the last hope of the people. Use the arcane elements to craft and cast magic spells upon the
enemy before they do the same to you.

The player rolls dice to gather elements (Fire, Air, Water). 
These can combined in different ways to cast different offensive and defensive spells.

The design was mainly inspired the Warcraft 3 custom map - SpellCraft.

—description from the designer

Name: Riddle Island: 1895
Description:
Riddle Island is a original series of escape room type game based on Taiwan’s three different era of history. As you progress and solving riddles, you will slowly reveal the true stories lie under the surface…

1895A.D. year of the goat. Taiwan is under war. The Japanese army has already conquered northern Taiwan and keep pushing south. In order to make the offence smoothly, they send you, a Japanese agent, to infiltrate into Tainan, where the government is. Are you be able to complete the mission before the attack begin?

—description from the publisher

Name: Riddle Island: 1943
Description:
Riddle Island is a original series of escape room type game based on Taiwan’s three different era of history. As you progress and solving riddles, you will slowly reveal the true stories lie under the surface…

1943A.D. Returning back to Takao, where you born and grow up, but this time is to find your missing lover. A letter, a notebook and a strange puzzle wheel, you receive these before your lover went missing.
Follow the clues and the track of your memories, can you find out where he is and the reason he left?

—description from the publisher

Name: Riddle Island: 1974
Description:
Riddle Island is a original series of escape room type game based on Taiwan’s three different era of history. As you progress and solving riddles, you will slowly reveal the true stories lie under the surface…

1974A.D. Your boss signs a new mission to you, this time you have to investigate a rebel activity, but the only clue you have is a riddle wheel that the rebels use to send messages. As you dig deeper and deeper, you start to realize that the truth is not like what you’ve thought.

—description from the publisher

Name: Big Boy Throwdown
Description:
- What is Big Boy Throwdown?? -

Big Boy Throwdown is an award-winning card and dice game about a bunch of weirdos fighting each other.Play your cards, roll the dice, get even more cards and play your way to the top!

Set in the world between dimensions known as the Between-Zone, the first deck of BBT features 100 unique cards and over 80 characters, including Angry Eggs, Strange Salesmen, Cosmic Clowns, Friendly Frogs, Chicken Champions, Noble Knights, Sentient Squares, a giant green cat named 'Dr. Uncle' and more.

BBT is all the fun and variety of classic trading card games, easy to learn and straight out of the box!

- The Game -

Gameplay runs in a slick & quick combination of strategy & chance, with players using the cards in their possession to attack their opponents' cards.If a player destroys an opponent's card, they roll to draw a random card from the Deck. This is the only reliable way to keep getting cards.

All cards have their own unique stats and a variety of Effects, which twist the rules and vary wildly in power & utility.

Because of the sheer number of cards in this first Deck, you may very well play half a dozen games of BBT before you see all of the unique, comical, and wonderfully surreal characters that we've packed into this first installment.

- The Details -

Recommended game size: 2-6 players
BBT is really designed for groups of 3 or more players, but does work with two players. More than 6 players can play BBT at a time, but game time will be longer as a result.

Avg. Game Length: 5-20 minutes

Ages 12+

- The Makers -

BBT is a labor-of-love project by Clown Car Entertainment, a small group of artists and creators centered in Pittsburgh, PA.

The game was first created in fall of 2016 when the makers were in college, and quickly won the hearts of their peers who played it between classes and during get-togethers. We're eternally grateful for all of the support they gave us; it helped us turn sketches on index cards into a fully fledged game project that anyone can play.

Name: Fallen knight
Description:
Fallen Knight is a 1-4 player cooperative dungeon crawler board game.
Theme, art, and mechanics are deeply connected, and the main character's unique ability is absorbing the memories of others. You can read (relive) people's stories , record their abilities, and find out  enemy weaknesses.

The gameplay is focused on strategic, ability based combat and exploring. Each ability belongs to a particular weapon master and class, with specific actions. This gives you a wide range of opportunities to create a character with the desired synergy. Part of our game art is shown in a comic book called the Memory Book. It charters the history of important characters in an uncensored,,18+ comic book format.

Gameplay
If you take our game monsters and bosses lightly, you are likely to get killed mercilessly. Exploit their weaknesses as this will help you win. At the beginning of the game, each player names their Knight and chooses 5 starting abilities. Before entering battle, select 3 of the 5 ability cards and utilize them to transform your Damned Sword.  With up to 20+ sub-action cards, you can flexibly tailor your attacks to deal with your immediate foes!. Explore our dark fantasy world and encounter different types of enemies, each with different behaviors. Killing monsters grants you the game's currency, Karma. Karma can be used to record abilities, purchase items, and level up characters. Leveling up your characters gives them more capacity to record abilities and creates more synergies with your ability cards.

Plot
Fallen Knights were created by the Gods to acquire and relive lost memories, though the Gods decided where they went and what they did. The lost memories recovered by the Fallen Knights never lasted long since every time they returned them to the Gods, they were reborn with no memories. This was a never-ending nightmare, a hellish cycle with no escape..
Now, the Gods are gone, the curse is broken, and every memory is available to Fallen Knights.. However, the memories are vague and unclear - like bad dreams - so it’s time to set out. Fallen Knights must forge their own path!

What about the Damned Sword of Fallen Knights?
If the corpse of a vanquished foe contains blood and flesh, the Damned Sword can be used directly to read memories. If the foe is long dead, and only the skeleton remains, then a sacred fire is required to harvest memories. Further still, players can use various abilities to turn their Damned Sword into weapons such as a bow, dagger, and even a Great Sword!

—description from the designer

Name: The Treasure Cave of Dragon
Description:
Holding an ancient treasure map, you keep going deeper and deeper into the dragon’s cave, hoping to find the treasure that you’ve been dreaming for. In front of you, there are three caves, on of them lies the treasure, but be ware, if choosing wrong, you might awake the dragon and bring trouble to the team… The map doesn’t show you which is the correct cave, but there’s a hint in the room, now is time to you your most powerful weapon-mathematic and probability!

The Treasure Cave of Dragon is a exciting game with dice rolling and push your luck mechanic, there are three times of dice rolling to reveal the correct cave of the treasures in each round, the earlier the players decide which cave they go in, the bigger chance they will be wrong but more treasures they might find…
Are you brave enough to rush in recklessly? Or wait until the situation becomes clearer…?

—description from the publisher

Name: Zazz
Description:
One of the first games to use a set of different polyhedral dice.

This is a decision-less game where players take turns rolling dice, and tallying their score. The first player past a point threshold wins.

The rules as published:

The Game is called ZAZZ and it is played with the 5 Natural Solids (Polyspheres).

TETRAHEDRON - has 4 Triangular Faces
CUBE - has 6 Square Faces
OCTAHEDRON - has 8 Triangular Faces
DODECAHEDRON - has 12 Pentagonal Faces
ICOSAHEDRON - has 20 Triangular Faces

Instructions: Each player throws all 5 solids at once as he takes his turn. Player inspects top faces, particularly all 3 showing faces of the TETRAHEDRON. He then adds all pairs or matching numbers plus any number over 12 that appears on the ICOSAHEDRON.

Example: Throw shows TETRAHEDRON 1, 3, 4; CUBE 6; OCTAHEDRON 3; DODECAHEDRON 8; ICOSAHEDRON 14

Add 3 on the TETRAHEDRON to matching 3 on OCTAHEDRON to 14 on ICOSAHEDRON. Score is 20 points.

Bonus of 20 Points for a 3-of-a-kind
Bonus of 50 Points for a 4-of-a-kind
Bonus of 100 Points for BLAST OFF

BLAST OFF occurs when the same throw shows no pairs, 3's, or 4's-of-a-kind and the number appearing on the ICOSAHEDRON is under 12.

A cumulative score of 100 points or a BLAST OFF wins the game.

Name: Quiz Master: Terrific Totally Trivia
Description:
Totally Terrific Trivia is a family trivia game consisting of 900 questions spanning six categories and one six-sided die.

The game can be played with by individuals or teams. The die is used to determine starting player, and afterwards the corresponding question on the trivia card for the category the player or team chooses. The player or team on the left reads out the question. If the player/team gives the correct answer, they keep the card; if not, it is returned to the box and play passes to the left.

The goal of the game is for each team or player to obtain one card from each category. When this happens, the succeeding team or player wins.

Includes: 900 Questions, 1 die, and rules

Name: Cartoni Morti De Card Gheim
Description:
Players have to make a story by playing characters one next to the other.

Every  characters says something different and the combination can make odd and NSFW stories.

When seven character cards are played on a raw  the story is completed and the player that achieved his hidden goal is the Winner!

What about the others?

Well...Losers have to make amends.... with repentance cards!!!

Who are the characters?

Stegosandro, the Mayor of Lignano and other great characters made by the Famuos Youtuber and Artist Andrea Lorenzon. also known as "Cartoni Morti".

—description from the publisher

Name: GVE
Description:
Themed based on Gods, Immortals and Celestials battling one another until the strongest remains.

Game can be played up from 2 to 4 players with the goal of eliminating your opponent's active warriors to seize victory. The game mainly revolves around rolling the dice in order to decide your move and your cards to decide your strength or weakness.

—user summary

Name: ナワバリ (Nawabari)
Description:
In ãƒŠãƒ¯ãƒãƒª (Nawabari), the players compete over a series of rounds to score the most points.

Each round is composed of 3 or 4 turns, in which players will draft a card from a row.  At the start of each turn, some cards are turned face up and ordered by number.  The players each draft a card in the order of their tokens, from left to right, and the placement of these tokens on the cards from this turn will determine the turn order for the next round.

Once selected, a player takes the chosen card and places it in front of themselves. The cards have a number of attributes, such as odd/even number; terrain type; and card effect.  Some cards provide an immediate benefit; others allow conversions; and some are conditional effects.

At the end of each round, players will score for the current round's scoring card, and other scoring types. Afterwards, the players simultaneously choose one card from their tableau to keep, which also determines turn order for the next round.

Name: Count Up
Description:
Count Up is a card game from Japan. Players draw from a deck and play cards from their hand face-up to a central stack, accumulating the total as they go. If a player can exactly hit a target, 11, 22, 33 and so on, the other players take penalty chips.

Instead of a number card, a player can place an action card, which trigger simple effects. Players fight a duel with hand cards, exchange cards, change direction, play two cards, play a wild card 1-3 and so on.

The game ends when a player takes the total over 100, and hand cards force more penalties. The player with the fewest penalty chips at the end is the winner.

The action cards have a simple English keyword and graphics, so the game is playable by anyone who can count.
user summary

Name: Where's Wally? Find it Fast! Game
Description:
The Where’s Wally Find It Fast game is a brilliant, fun, quick paced matching game! Pick a card that contains a multiple images of Where’s Wally and other general objects then roll the picture dice – find an image on the dice that matches one on the card to win the round. The player who finds the most matches wins.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Alias: Ensimmäinen Muumi
Description: A word explanation game in Finnish starting from ages 3 and up. The game has cards with pictures and the words are written both in Finnish and in Swedish. The game itself is set in Moominvalley and many characters are presented in playing cards.

Name: Ｄｒ．野口っち (Dr. Nogucchi)
Description:
ï¼¤ï½’ï¼Žé‡Žå£ã£ã¡ (Dr. Nogucchi) ã©ããŸãƒ¼ã®ãã£ã¡ (Dokuta no Guchi) is a game from Japan which includes a model microscope. Players use the fake microscope to study specimens, looking for the cure, the silver bullet to cure a terrible disease (the game was first published in 2017!).

Players look through the microscope to identify different viruses. If a player is confident that they have the cure, they declare and gain 2 points if correct, or lose 1 pt if wrong. Other players can still find the cure and gain a point. The first to get to 5 points is the winner.

The specimens are card hexes with different combinations of microbes showing in each part. When a player peeks into the microscope, the card is rotated, so they only see a section at a time. Remember what you have seen in the scope is important to the game.

There are tokens for the microbes and for coloured test tubes of drugs. Players build up a collection of drugs and bugs behind their laboratory screen. When a player is confident they have the right combo to complete the cure, they can declare.
user summary

Name: Clash of Deck N°5
Description:
Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the fifth expansion of the game. Each month, a new expansion is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. A new game mechanic makes its appearance: the cards which rotate on themselves. You will also be able to discover two new special abilities that will add even more combos and depth to your games: Aquatic and Hidden!

Name: 化けドラ～化け物對化け物ドラフトゲーム～ (BAKEDORA- The Monster War Draft Game)
Chat pardeurs
Description:
Chat pardeur is a tactical and lucky microgame for 2 players facing each other during 5-minute games and can be played from 5 years old.

Fear has seized San Franciscat. Food factories are the target of recurrent robberies. But have no fear, Supercat is determined to bring the thieves to justice.
If you are the Kitthief, you have to steal 5 foods of the same type to win. If you are supercat, you must stop the Kitthief by knocking him out.

The kitthief secretly chooses a food on the food card by placing his token on it. Supercat has to guess which food is selected.
If supercat has made a mistake, the kitthief raises the token corresponding to the food on the card.
If supercat has found it, he rolls the dice and try to hit the kitthief.

-description from designer

Name: Tierra Feudal
Description:
Tierra Feudal (Feudal Land) is a card game where we represent the leader of a noble house from medieval Europe. We are on a mission to develop our fiefdom better than anyone else through the recruitment of new vassals, the construction of buildings, the establishment of production improvements and, of course, the growth of our military defenses.

Starting from a few cards, we will have to manage the production of resources to be able to get better characters, buildings and nobles from the market that allow us to make more efficient and productive combinations of cards. We will have to carefully plan our acquisitions since the lack of chance in the game will place almost all the responsibility of defeat or victory on our decisions.

After the construction of a certain amount of buildings the game will end. The military and economic power, the productive capacities, the power of the church and the nobles under our vassalage will determine the victory points that we get and the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Hollerith⁵
Description:
Hollerithâµ consists of a 6x6 game board with a hole in each space large enough to hold a marble, as well as marbles in two colors and five perforated plates; each plate covers a 3x3 area, which means that four of the plates together cover the entire game board. Each perforated plate has nine holes so that you can see whether a hole in the game board is filled with a marble, but only one or two holes per plate are large enough for a marble to pass through. (These holes are marked as such on the plates.)

On a turn, you push the fifth plate onto the game board, displacing one of the plates already there, then you insert one of your marbles into an unoccupied hollow of the game board. Players alternate turns until one of them forms a row of four marbles and wins. Note that if you cannot insert a marble into an empty space on the game board, you lose instantly.

Name: 二つの罪と三人の死者 ～二人用脱出ミステリー～ (Two Sins and Three Dead: A Two-Person Escape Mystery)
Description:
äºŒã¤ã®ç½ªã¨ä¸‰äººã®æ­»è€… ï½žäºŒäººç”¨è„±å‡ºãƒŸã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒªãƒ¼ï½ž (Futatsu no Tsumi to San'nin no Shisha) (Two Sins and Three Dead: A Two-Person Escape Mystery) is a game from Japan.

This is a mystery game to move the story forward through conversation. At a friend's house at night, there is a suspicious person under the bed... What are the consequences for A and B, who both have their secrets?

ä¼šè©±ã§ç‰©èªžã‚’é€²ã‚ã‚‹ãƒŸã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒªãƒ¼
å‹äººå®…ã®å¤œã€ãƒ™ãƒƒãƒ‰ã®ä¸‹ã«ä¸å¯©è€…ãŒ……
ãã‚Œãžã‚Œã®ç§˜å¯†ã‚’æŠ±ãˆã‚‹Aã¨BãŒè¿Žãˆã‚‹çµæœ«ã¨ã¯ï¼Ÿ
publisher's summary

In this 2 player game, the player's adopt the roles of persons 'A' and 'B'. B is visiting A and stays in A's university room. But at night, they realise there is a suspicious figure under A's bed. B is alarmed, even more so by A's calm response.

During the game, the players converse, trying to get information to undercover the truth. The game has three main endings that can be reached, but the players each have secrets (hidden through QR codes), so the players cannot be sure how the game will end. This gives the game much replay ability, even if they do reach an ending.

Players get information from cards in the game, dependent on where they are in the room, or from keywords appearing in the talking. The players are allowed to reveal information, or hide, or even lie if they wish. The game may unfold as the players wish, or they be disturbed by the secrets revealed (the game is aimed at older players). Playing out the roles in different ways may make the endings change too.

Players will need access to some digital device to examine the QR codes in the game.
user summary

Name: Russian Railroads: Manufactory Train
Description:
A mini-extension available as a free "Print & Play" version. Just print it and cut it out.

Setup:
• Place the manufactory train next to the game board, clearly visible for all players.
• Shuffle all 11 manufactory tiles, face-down, draw 2 of them at random and place them on the 2 right spaces on the manufactory train, faceup.  The first space remains empty for now.
• Draw 3 more tiles and place them next to the manufactory train-board, on the left, faceup.• Put the stack of 6 remaining manu-factory tiles above the train-board.

Gameplay:
The manufactory train works like any other action space in RRR.
• If you place a worker or coin on the train, you have to pick one of the 3 faceup manufactory tiles and place it onto the first (empty) space on the train – the space right behind the engine.
• Next you have to perform all three actions, shown on the manufactory tiles, in their entirety. If that is not possible, you cannot use the manufactory train action space. The order, however, is up to you.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Really?! Think you know me? Guess again!
Description:
Really?! Think you know me? Guess again! is a family-friendly party game that is all about you, your friends, and your family. 
How well do you really know your family and friends? Will your friends & family be able to guess your answers?

EASY TO PLAY: Simply read the question card and choose your answer from a list of potential answers on the card. Mark your answer on your number dial while other players guess your answer marking their number dials. For each correct guess – return one ice piece to the tumbler. When all your ice is in—you win!

All components fit inside a 24oz tumbler - 6 number dials to mark your chosen answer, 60 sparkling play ice pieces for scoring, 100 conversation starter cards with over 500 answers and simple instruction sheet.

AWARDS & HONORS
Creative Child – 2022 Game of the Year Award
Tillywig Toy Awards - Best Family Fun

Name: Triple Tongue Twisters: Go Fish with a Twist!
Description:
Can you say “Happy Hippo Hiccupped” out loud, three times, fast? Collect sets of "3 word" Triple Tongue Twisters and say them out loud without your tongue tying to score points. The funniest “Go Fish with a Twist” and dare we say...most educational.
Playing Triple Tongue Twisters is so much fun, you will not realize you are perfecting your English with each game played.

Name: Old Century Drag Racing
Description:
Intro:

     1934 on the flats of the California desert Drag Racing was born.
     1940’s-1950’s grew the popularity of illegal street racing among high-schoolers


Finding a quick thrill and showing off their cars.

     Mid 1950’s the first legal ¼ mile drag strip was built and the popularity grew.
     Today exists many different classes of professional drag racing from top fuel, funny car, pro-stock, and more…….with large purses to be won.
     Old Century Drag Racing captures the excitement in a quick easy head to head competitive match right on your kitchen table.


Gentleman/Ladies – Start Your Engines!

Object of the Game:
Compete in a one-time ¼ mile classic style drag race and be the first to cross the finish line, or a best out of three or five races for a more competitive race. Best out of three or five races is recommended.

—description from the designer

Name: ぬくみ温泉繁盛記 第一拡張 開業支援 (Nukumi Onsen Hanjoki: Kaigyo Shien)
Tangier to Tehran: a Wargamer guide to Middle Eastern Armies of the Napoleonic & Pre-colonial era c1780-1830
Description:
Tangier to Tehran
Basic set of wargaming rules for 6mm and a guide about the armies of the middle east during the 1780-1830 period.

It cover the armies, navies and potted history of the Arab states of the period (Morocco, Algeria, Tunis, Tripoli, Egypt, Syria, Palestine, Lebanon, Persia, Hejaz, Iraq, Wahhabis of the Nejd, Yemen, Oman), as well as foreign interventionists (Turkey, Great Britain, France, Russia, USA,    Sweden).
It includes drawings of uniforms, maps and flags

Published in 1994, updated in 2012.

Name: Small Ball
Description:
Small Ball is a two-player, push-your-luck dice game that celebrates the highly strategic style of baseball known as "small ball", which places an emphasis on manufacturing runs by way of single-base advancements and aggressive base running.

Teams are made up of nine unique dice that each reflect the typical characteristics of batters in a lineup, including the lead-off hitter who gets on base, the clean-up hitter who is capable of powerful extra-base hits, and the pitcher who can sacrifice a runner over.

â€‹Small Ball challenges teams to score runs by making tough, strategic decisions - when to steal a base, when to lay down a sacrifice, when to call the hit-and-run, and when to go to the bench for a pinch hitter - and implements a major rule change that makes decisions even more grueling.

—description from the designer

Name: トレンド・ザ・ブランチ (Trend: The Branch)
Description:
ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ³ãƒ‰ãƒ»ã‚¶ãƒ»ãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒ (Trend: The Branch) is a stand-alone card game from Japan with a theme of the apparel business that re-implements the 2018 release TREND. In this edition, players are still staff of an apparel shop. There is an additional branch system that uses multiple shop cards with special effects and combines these effects.

While the rules are similar to the original game, differences in this edition are:
1. Introduction of a new rule to add a branch - This allows the effects and abilities of shop cards to be used in combination. 
2. Adding of four seasons to the character card - With the addition of the four seasons, you can enjoy the changing trends of the seasons and the changing fashion of the city.
3. Simple changes to the sales and pass rules - The basic rules have been revised to be simpler and easier to play.
4. All 132 cards - The number of cards has increased by 50 from the previous game, making it a more challenging game. Overall, the number of trend elements has increased to 20 and the number of shops to 12.
user summary

Name: －天動説－ (Geocentric Theory)
Description:
ï¼å¤©å‹•èª¬ï¼ (TendÅsetsu) (Geocentric Theory) is a game from Japan, with players sailing ships on a Flat Earth. The game title translates more literally as Theory Of The Moving Heavens. Geocentric Theory (often simplified as Ptolemaic Theory) puts the Earth at the centre of the Universe.

The players sail their ships on the oceans, searching for the treasure island of the Pirate King. But if they sail too close to the edge of the world, over they go!

The game includes an Armillary sphere to help the players navigate. There is a day phase and  a night phase. During the day, the navigator reads the winds and the waves, and at night, the stars. When an undiscovered island is found, players can search for clues to the location of the gold and silver treasures.

As well as the 20cm tall sphere, the game also has the sea in a box. When it is not their turn, a player moves the box around to bring the sound of the sea alive.
user summary

Name: Oddia
Description:
Oddia is a contraction for "Odd and Diagonal."  It means that when a player gets an odd number, they should move their token diagonally (except when the token in in a corner square.)

The object of Oddia is to gain the highest points by moving the tokens to reach the Target.  Each token reaching the target will get one point.

Game Setup
The game board consists of 36 squares along the sides of the board making up the game zone.  The middle part of the board with diagonal lines (squares) only function as a passage and tokens cannot stop on it.  Start is on one corner and 19 which is the Target is on the opposite corner.

Players take multiple sets of 10 tokens in their color depending on how many players are playing (2 players = 6 sets, 3 players = 4 sets, 4 players 3 sets.)  The tokens are numbered 1-10 in each set.

The game starts with setting up the board for the first 12 turns.  Players take turns putting their "1" tokens on start, rolling one die (for the 1st 6 turns, 2 dice after that) and moving forward.  Play moves counter-clockwise around the board.  When moving diagonal, play moves clockwise.

If they land on another player the player sitting on that square is bumped diagonally across the board. If a player lands on a player in corner square, the player sitting in that corner square is bumped on backward.  As more tokens are placed on the board multiple chain-reactions can take place, bumping multiple players to new spaces.  After 12 "1" tokens have been played on the board the game is ready to start.

Game Play
During game play only 12 tokens are allowed on the board.  Tokens can be replaced with higher numbered tokens.

During game play you choose which one token you wish to move.  Once a token reaches the Target (19 space) they replace their token with the next higher number token which gets placed on start and if the dice number is higher than the number needed to reach the Target then the upgraded token moves the additional spaces from the Start space.

The game continues until on person reaches the target with their number 10 token.  Their points for that token will be 11.  All players then count the number of all their tokens on the board and the player with the highest point total wins.

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Pays de Loire
Description:
Trivial Pursuit: Pays de Loire
Discover or rediscover the French Loire country in 3000 questions from the following 6 categories:

     Geography,
     Entertainment,
     History,
     Art and Literature,
     Science and Nature,
     Sports and Leisure.

Name: MLB Baseball Trivia Challenge
Description: If you love Major League Baseball and think you know baseball better than anyone else, here’s your chance to prove it with the new MLB Baseball Trivia Challenge board game. To win, you’ll need more than baseball knowledge and luck on your side because strategy is what separates this unique trivia game from the pack. With 1,000 questions, every baseball player will have to be up to the challenge. For MLB fans who think they've got game, it's time to put on your cap, grab your bat, and knock it out of the park in the new Baseball Trivia Challenge.

Name: Mega Mouth
Description:
Everyone is a lip-reader in this game of massive mouth magnification.

Draw a category card, hold the mega-magnifier up to your mouth, and silently speak to your teammates. Don't say the words out loud! Players are awarded tokens for every answer they guess correctly.

Name: Magna-Tiles: Treasure Hunt
Description: Magna-Tiles: Treasure Hunt combines the power of play with hands-on learning and creativity! Collect golden coins in Jungle Treasure, act like a monkey in Island Race, or create their own game by making new rules! Magna-Tiles: Treasure Hunt is a great first game that grows with your child and encourages fine motor skills, imagination, social development, and more!

Name: Rattlesnake Jake
Description: Rattlesnake Jake has stolen your gold! Watch out for his rattle, and carefully sneak the gold back. One wrong move… and he strikes! His ominous rattle builds the suspense for the ultimate jump! If Rattlesnake Jake strikes on your turn, you must return half of your nuggets to him. The player with the most gold when the last nugget has been taken wins the game.

Name: Burping Bobby
Description: Bobby loves stinky food! Feed him, but watch out – you never know when he’s going to BUUUURRRRP! Real lights and steam will burst from his mouth when he burps! The player with the most points after Bobby burps wins.

Name: Neo-Morphosis: The Syndicate's Sleeper
Description:
The Syndicate's Sleeper expansion for Neo-Morphosis allows for 5 or 6 players. This expansion adds a new mechanic - Betrayer Mode! The syndicate may have an Agent hidden in the crew with their own secret agenda! Who is the traitor? What is their agenda?

Includes two new Crew, Jasper Jackson and Akira Gozen, new alien species, the Tubers, Widows, and Borers. Plus more morphosis and the mighty Behemoth!

Comes with map tiles, item cards, emergency cards, and 10 brand new Missions that can also be played as a campaign!

—description from the publisher

Name: Blah Blah Blah
Description:
Finally, a way to make practicing phonics fun!

Master decoding words using phonics with these three decks of increasing difficulty. Race to get rid of your cards by matching sounds and letters, and play wild cards to trip up your opponents!

Blah Blah Blah is a hilariously fun card game, perfect for kids who are just starting to learn to read. Master decoding words using phonics with these three decks of increasing difficulty. Race to get rid of your cards by matching sounds and letters, and play wild cards to trip up your opponents!

How does Blah Blah Blah work?

Every card features a word consisting of three letters (or groups of letters). Each player takes seven cards. One card is placed face-up on the table with the rest of the deck in a pile, face-down. Players must play a card from their hand that contains at least one of the letters that are in the word on the table. The first player to get rid of all their cards wins. But beware! Wild cards hidden in the deck can force you to skip your turn or draw more cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Who did it?: Mammoth Promo Cards
Description:
A package of promotional cards of another animal for 'Who did it?' which the community voted for in a facebook voting in March 2019.

Six additional cards showing a mammoth in each of the original player colors. Another animal that you also have to remember when trying to figuring out 'Who did it?'.

Name: Rituels
Description:
Inspired by the game For the Queen, Rituels (french for "Rituals"), is a card-based story-building game that you and up to five other players can begin playing in minutes. Choose your cult and ritual, then use the prompt cards to collaboratively tell a story of love, betrayal, doubt, and devotion.

Rituels will have you roam the lands of cultists trying to summon a creature capable of destroying the whole univers. But will all partakers go through with this plan till the end?

The game suggests 8 Cults and 8 Rituals.
The prompt cards are divided in 2 decks: Act I (Why did the characters join the cult, what are their hopes and dreams?) and Act II (What are these nightmares troubling your sleep more and more as the day of the Ritual is getting closer? Are your teammates trustworthy? Are you really one the right side?).
A Final Act in a black envelop will have you secretly vote for the success or failure of the Ritual, ending the game one of three ways.

Name: Donjons & Siphons
Description:
Inspired by the game For the Queen, Donjons & Siphons (french for "Dungeons and Plumbing Traps"), is a card-based story-building game that you and up to five other players can begin playing in minutes. Choose your dungeon and use the prompt cards to collaboratively tell a story of love, conspiration, doubt, and hardships.

Donjons & Siphons will let you take on the fabulous roles of janitors in a dungeon, competing to become the Chief Janitor.
The game suggests 10 base characters (with different special powers and races). The players then take turns answering prompts from the Event deck. The cards of this deck have two questions: one for you and for your shift teammate (another player).
When the Event deck is empty, you'll have to vote for the best Chief (other than you). The game ends with the Chief's speech.

Name: Don't drop the soap: Deathrow
Description:
The Social Card game where there are no winners, just one loser.
Don’t Drop The Soap is a dark humored, fast-paced card game of hot potato set in a prison shower. Players take the role of prison inmates who are, literally, trying to screw each other over. The objective of the game is to not be the player who drops the soap.
Each turn players must play one action card from their hand. The game ends when a player runs out of options and is forced to play a soap card. Although you may never win a game of ‘Don’t Drop The Soap’ you can influence the game in such a way that you decides who loses.

Are you skilled enough to get the booty you want? Or will you end up as someone else prison bitch? You do what you gotta do in here, just Don’t Drop The Soap.

"One last soap before we go?"
Deathrow is first expansion for Don’t drop the soap with additional cards!

Name: Boereplaas: Uitbreidingstel 1
Description:
Boereplaas Uitbreidingstel 1 expands the original Boereplaas with 72 new cards.

These new cards promises more interaction between players as well as more powerful bonus cards.

The rules for three different game modes are also included: Original, Strategic and Blitz.

Name: Rainbow Yatzy
Description: Roll the dice inside the rainbow box and try to match the colours in order to collect cards. The more cards you collect, the higher your score will be. Be careful though, because sometimes your efforts may end up helping out the next player...

Name: Chakan Board Game
Description:
Join Chakan the Forever Man as he traverses the “Journey of 100 Candles” spell with the fate of the world hanging in the balance. Can the greatest warrior of "The Before" time finally rematch Death himself and free himself
from the “Immortality Curse”? Play on!!!!

To play the game: roll a d6 to move your token, follow the directions on the space you land on (e.g., draw a Fate Card, Battle another player, draw an Encounter Card). You earn points by collecting various Encounter Cards, saving Energy points, and triggering the end of the game. The player with the most total points wins!

Name: Disci
Description:
In Disci, you want to move your pieces across the board and into the opponent's starting zone before they can do the same. You can move pieces individually or jump over a piece to land on the empty space just past it. In doing so, however, you may not enter the large space in the center of the board. What's more, if you end up on a space marked with an "X", you must vacate this space in the next round, even moving backwards toward your starting area, if necessary.

The opponent cannot block you by leaving pieces in their starting zone as those spaces count as filled and will make it easier for you to win.

Name: Beach Slap!
Description:
Compete to snapshot beach photo assignments for your editor! Up to six people can race to find and arrange hidden objects called out by your impatient editor. This party game contains 48 Snapshot cards and 12 Assignment cards. Fast-paced and silly, this game is full of charming illustrations of a cornucopia of characters!

—description from the publisher

Name: Bettor Horse
Description:
Can you read your opponent and emerge the better bettor? Are your horses the faster or slower runners versus your opponent's? Successfully bet on horse races to beat your opponent in a game that requires no shuffling and gives you access to your deck the entire game. Find out who the real thoroughbred is in this equestrian, mind-reading competition.

—description from the publisher

Name: Detetive Cartas
Description: The Classic Detective won its card version! To solve the mystery of Mr. Carlos Fortuna's murder, players will have to make guesses about the location, weapon and the person responsible for the crime. In each round the participants will be able to eliminate at least one possibility, until finally there will be very few cards left and it will be possible to make an accusation. Whoever succeeds wins the game, but if the guess is wrong the player will be out of the game.

Name: Cuboingo: 2x2
Description:
Cuboingo is a puzzle card game in which you match colored patterns to fill up sides of your "Cuboingo!" Jump right into geometric gameplay that can help improve memory, abstract visualization, pattern recognition, and strategy. There are 3 versions of Cuboingo to enjoy (each sold separately). The 2x2 version is the fastest-paced and easiest to learn.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cuboingo: 3x3
Description:
Cuboingo is a puzzle card game in which you match colored patterns to fill up sides of your "Cuboingo!" Jump right into geometric gameplay that can help improve memory, abstract visualization, pattern recognition, and strategy. There are 3 versions of Cuboingo to enjoy (each sold separately). The 3x3 version exercises tactical thinking.

—description from the publisher

Name: Combate Cartas
Description: To win, players will have to devise a strategy and choose the correct cards each round in order to eliminate the enemy's army.

Name: Cuboingo: 4x4
Description:
Cuboingo is a puzzle card game in which you match colored patterns to fill up sides of your "Cuboingo!" Jump right into geometric gameplay that can help improve memory, abstract visualization, pattern recognition, and strategy. There are 3 versions of Cuboingo to enjoy (each sold separately). The 4x4 version exercises strategic thinking.

—description from the publisher

Name: War of Waves
Description:
Wield mighty waves and crushing sand to build your gateway to Atlantis before your opponent! Heavy strategy is required to outwit your opponent - choose to attack, fortify, or build - or combine different actions, and every choice determines what cards you draw; populate each bridge section with a war card to allow attacking your opponent's gate or to build your own; build abiding by the rules or fix any mistakes before you claim victory!

Build your bridge and your army while thwarting your opponent's. Learn some Greek to go along with some mythology as you march your army victorious through the gate to the fabled undersea kingdom!

—description from the publisher

Name: Aeon's End Outcasts: Promos
Description:
Promo pack for Aeons's End.  Contains promo cards P096 through P123, SD-058, and NA-END-044.

This pack includes:

     Coruscating Sapal and randomizer - Gem
     Force Catalyst and randomizer - Spell
     Humming Shell and randomizer - Relic
     2 Treasured Gems
     2 Treasures Level 2
     3 Treasures Level 3
     2 Upgraded Basic Nemesis Attacks
     2 Upgraded Basic Nemesis Powers
     3 Xaxos: Outcast Abilities
     2 additional story related randomizers

Name: Golygame
Description:
Golygame is a football theme board game played with chips (players and ball) and dice for passing, shooting, tackling, etc. It combines the strategy thinking to make right actions in your turn with the luck that the dice bring to the game. Score three goals before your rival to be the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Diecast Derby
Description:
Using only Diecast Toy Cars and 9 Print and Play cards, Drivers attempt to position their cars first place by the end of the race. Play occurs over an extremely limited number of card plays (less than 4 per lap/race) so each individual card play requires strategy and tactics.

Solo puzzle mode and three variant play modes are included in the original rules.

—description from the designer

Name: Clash at Rook's Point
Description:
Rook’s Point: Center of power, magic…and mystery. Factions will rise and forces will convene, vying for control of this mystical apex. Control Rook’s Point, control the world.

Choose your faction and fight your opponent. Use your powers, abilities, and sheer strength to answer the ultimate question: who will be the last one standing when warriors Clash at Rook’s Point?
Players will choose a faction of three characters, all with their own unique powers and abilities. Decks are identical, each containing the same cards, the only difference is how they are shuffled. Heal your characters, take two actions, and move to the next player. Gameplay is fast and furious, with no forgiveness for mistakes. Knock out all of an opponent’s characters to eliminate them from the game. Be the last player standing to win control of Rook’s Point—but beware! Strategies and alliances might work this time, but how long will they last?

—description from the designer

Name: Fleet: The Dice Game – Captain & Trophy Expansion
Description:
Fleet: The Dice Game - Captain & Trophy Expansion includes:

5 - Starting Captains - Players can draft these cards at the beginning of the game to grant special starting positions

10 - Trophy Cards - 5 of these will provide mid-game bonuses for the first player to reach their condition. The other 5 will provide end game bonuses - using 1 of the 5 per game.

You do not need these cards if you own the Fleet: The Dice Game â€“ Deluxe Extras.

—description from the publisher

Name: Maratón Ligero
Description:
Maratón Ligero ("Light Marathon"), is one of  versions of Maratón, a Mexican trivia game created by Sergio Schaar Chabat.  In this case, the questions, according to the text in the back of the box, are specialized in pop music, movie hits, sports and TV shows, contrary to the original one, who was more into general culture.

To play, a player rolls the dice and a judge reads a numered question in the front of the card, according to the dice points. After the player ansewers, the judge checks the back of the card to confirm. If the player was right, his token advances, if not, another player can doit. Is nobody knows it, then a black token called Ignorancia (Ignorance), advances.

The winner is the first player to reach the end line. If the Ignorance token does first, everybody loses.

Name: Circino: le Chasseur de Trésors – Destination Bouches-du-Rhône
Description:
Circino A Treasure Hunt in the Bouches-du-Rhône

From Marseille to Aubagne, via Aix-en-Provence, La Ciotat, Arles etc ... 36 municipalities of the "13" department will occupy a central and predominant spot in the game.

Goal of the game
The players select 8 "Objective" cards (= 8 communes) and they collect the 8 "Objective" pellets corresponding to these 8 cards. They shuffle them face down then place them on the different chests on the game board.

Each player then collects at random or he chooses 2 "Objective" cards among the 8 selected.

The goal of the game will consist in finding the 2 “Objective” pellets corresponding to his 2 cards then in bringing them back the 1st to Circino in the center of the board ... with as only weapons the dice and his sense of adventure!

In their quest, players will not be alone and can count on the help of members of the Circino family through Bonus Cards.

Name: Bon Appetit
Description:
Bon Appetit is a simple word game. Each alphabet has turned into a delicious cuisine, by using them to form a word, you will have a grant feast.
Bon Appetit!

—description from the publisher

Name: 動文字
Description:
å‹•æ–‡å­— is a Chinese word game, or should I say, “character game”.
Using radicals and components to puzzle a Chinese character and spell it. Learning Chinese in a exciting competition!
Can you master this ancient and elegant language? å‹•æ–‡å­— will show you a whole new world of Chinese learning!

—description from the publisher

Name: Die Schatzinsel der Piratenopas
Description:
Die Schatzinsel der Piratenopas (The Treasure Island of Pirate Grandpas) is a handmade wooden children's game from 5 years up. It is made in the “Urdonautal” in the heart of Bavaria. 
It is also ideally suited as a family game, because it is just as fun for adults and offers new challenges for experienced players because there are rule extensions that can optionally be included in the game. In addition to a little luck, a good memory is required, because if you can remember which types of treasure are hidden in which place, you have a good chance of winning the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Proyecto S
Description: Construct your deck in an initial phase of secret bidding combined with drafting. Use your new cards and their special powers in a second round of secret biding to win victory points, but make sure not to use all your tricks before the final round because if you lose it your victory points will not count.

Name: 九龙城寨 (The City of Darkness)
Description:
City of Darkness(Chinese name:ä¹é¾™åŸŽå¯¨/ä¹é¾åŸŽå¯¨,means Kowloon walled city) is a board game adapted from the comic of the same name.
Players play the roles in the comics and use their unique decks to fight for territory in Kowloon Walled City.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Malign Portents
Description:
It began with unsettling dreams, and unnatural lights in the sky. Tempers frayed, families fractured and rulers became irate as their subjects fell to distraction and gossip. There was something in the air, they said; some malediction that threatened to turn the disquiet into dread. Waking nightmares spread across every land, promising a deathly face or the terror of oblivion. Traders and explorers carried ominous accounts through Realmgates only to find those on the other side bore disturbing stories of their own. This period became known as the Time of Tribulation, and it was well-named.

Malign Portents is an 80-page hardback book containing background and rules which catapult the mortal realms into a time of grim uncertainty, as Nagash begins an aeons-long grand plan to assert his power over the dead, spreading the necrotic influence of Shyish over every realm. Of course, the visions of disaster this plan is causing have not gone unnoticed – Khorne, Nurgle, Tzeentch, Slaanesh, the Horned Rat and Sigmar himself are affected by these portents, and every faction in the mortal realms is moving against the undead hordes of Nagash.

Name: SiegKrone
Description:
SiegKrone (means Victory Crown) is a trading card game published by famous Japanese SNS company GREE. The game contains a lot of mobile game ip and anime ip like attack on titan.

Like most tcgs, in this game, players should construct their own deck with 50 cards to fight with the opponent. Players play character cards to fight and use skill cards to help. Some character cards can evolution or awake. The player who causes 5 points of damage to the opposing player will win the game.

Name: Changemakers Adventure
Description:
The goal of Adventure is to help to grow a changemaker that is in yourself and to develop world changing teams. Throughout the game you develop your performing courage, listening skill and lot more.

To be the first one to reach the top of the mountain you have to do a variety of tasks. For example you can share about your childhood, make a speech, compete with fellow players, give promises or guess other people's personality types.

After each activity/question you will get point based on your performance.
Who's the first on top of the mountain, has changed the world for the better, like a changemaker.

Name: Kosmiczny Wykop
Description:
Galactic football from the Cosmic Kick series has moved to the game board. Together with Robert Lewandowski and the series characters, play the emotional football games full of tactical decisions. The dynamic 2-player gameplay will make you feel like you’re at Spaceball court - the Space Football Federation stadium.

—description from the publisher

Name: Farbiossis Vernissage
Description:
“Farbiossis Vernissage” is a handmade wooden family game from 10 years up made in the “Urdonautal” in the heart of Bavaria. Who can best achieve the most points by cleverly collecting and swapping combinations of images?

The goal of the game is to get the most pictures into the own gallery.

At start every player gets 8 pictures on his sorting station.

In each round every player has to put at least 1 (max. 3) of this pictures on his paletts.
The pictures have 3 different characteristics: background, colour and motive. Collect pictures on a palett, that have at least 2 characteristics, that fit.

Then each player fills up his sorting station with new pictures from the reserve.

Every player looks, what picture he didn't need to collect a combination and puts that picture into the middle of the table.

Then everyone chooses pictures from the middle of the table for his sorting station.

If you have no picture that fits to the pictures on the paletts you must bring the pictures of one palette into the gallery and get points.

When the reserve is empty the game ends.

The player who reaches the most points is the winner of the game.

-description from designer

Name: Landsknecht: Renaissance Wargame Rules
Description:
Landsknecht is a set of rules for the Renaissance period, allowing players to recreate the battles of the Renaissance wars in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Colonels of the period. Between the heavy armour of the gendarmes and the structure of the early pike and shot formation, players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with cunning and bloody stubbornness.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

Landsknecht aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the century, where looks and righteousness were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments and an option to wear over the top fashion was nether missed. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's webpage

Name: We Have a Problem, Mr. President: Historical Expansion
Description:
This product is an expansion to “We Have a Problem, Mr. President…” The base game is sold separately.

Journey back to the past to tackle memorable moments of crisis with the Historical Expansion for “We Have A Problem, Mr. President…” the National Emergency Game. Whether you find yourself guiding the nation through the aftermath of Pearl Harbor, negotiating and problem-solving through the Arab Oil Embargo, or deescalating the tensions of the Cuban Missile Crisis, these new and unique decks will test your skills as the advisor to the president. Clear them and protect your nation’s history!

Name: The Comic Book Bubble
Description:
In The Comic Book Bubble, you invest in comics of the modern era, represented by covers of comics from publisher Red 5 Comics. Buy comics when the market is low, and sell for a profit.

Each turn, players simultaneously select action cards - buy a comic, manipulate the market, or use the card's superpower. The market is comprised of various genres that rise and fall throughout the game.

Comics are bought and sold for the current market value of the genres on the card. As the game progresses, the genre variance increases - comics become worth a lot more - and less!

Are you savvy enough to make money before the bubble bursts?

—description from the publisher

Name: Killer Party: Fangs for the Memories
Description:
It's opening night at The Coffin Door, the nightclub run by celebrity vampire Vlad Fanger.  Vlad is the vampire all the other vampires want to be and mortal wannabes wannabe bitten by.  But his body was just discovered in the VIP section.  Now He's not the Undead, he's just dead.

Killer Party is a series of Social Mystery Party Games for adults.  Do crazy stunts and challenges to earn clues.  Get points for scratching off the right answers.  Score the most points to solve the murder.

Includes: 3 killer envelopes with introduction sheets, 12 clue cards, 12 scratch-off investigation cards, 1 killer conclusion envelope.

Name: Kämpfe in Reihen: Lace Wars Wargames Rules
Description:
Kämpfe in Reihen is a set of rules for the Lace Wars period, allowing players to recreate the linear style battles in a way that emphasises the role played by the Gentlemen and Colonels of the period. Players will need to seize control of every situation, in order to win the day with dash and swagger.

The rules use a no-dice mechanism, aiming to bring the fun and suspense back into wargaming. They are designed to allow large games with lots of commands and are suitable for multi-player games for an evening, or longer.

Kämpfe in Reihen aims to give a feel for the period and the way command and control worked in the century, where looks and righteousness were as much a part of battle as good training and armaments. They make no claim to be overly historically accurate.

—description from the publisher's website
